result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Deferred Agreement of a Guilty Plea is granted by the Court for a period of 12 months.  The defendant pled guilty to the charge. Rights given. Court finds that they have entered their plea knowingly, intelligently and of their own free will and finds the defendant guilty.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  The defendant shall have no contact with N.K.E.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.   Exception third party contact for child visitation/placement is allowed.  Defendant may have one time with officer assistance to retrieve personal belongings.
**AMENDED** 1/27/22 - Defendant shall have no violent or abusive contact with N.K.E., all other previous conditions remain the same.
